main event: A civilian witness observed a bright, starlike object moving rapidly in the sky over Bonice, Connecticut on October 20, 1950.
interesting points: The object was about 10 times brighter than the planet Venus.
The object had a steady, orange glowing color and no blinking lights.
The object moved rapidly away toward the east and then disappeared.
The witness estimated the object was at an altitude of less than 2,000 feet.
The sighting lasted for about 20 seconds.
result: The report concludes that the observation was rather short, and all other data indicates an aircraft sighting, which was placed in that category.
photographs: Yes, the report includes one photograph
